content:
Diagnosis
	1. High grade serous carcinoma of endometrium, T3bN1M0
	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, omentectomy and pelvic lymphadenectomy performed by [redacted name]

	Chemotherapy
	Planned for carboplatin/paclitaxel with trastuzumab

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Post-operative, awaiting adjuvant therapy

	Current issues
	Post-operative recovery
Mild lymphoedema right leg
Anxiety regarding chemotherapy

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name], a 62-year-old lady, in clinic today following her recent surgery for high-grade serous carcinoma of the endometrium. Histopathology has confirmed a grade 3 serous carcinoma with cervical stromal invasion and lymphovascular space invasion. One of twelve pelvic lymph nodes was positive for metastatic disease. Molecular testing has identified a TP53 mutation and HER2 positivity (IHC 3+). CT staging shows no evidence of distant metastatic disease.

She has recovered well from surgery with good wound healing. She reports mild lymphoedema of the right leg which is responding to compression stockings. Her main concern today is anxiety about starting chemotherapy. We had a detailed discussion about the role of combined chemotherapy and targeted therapy with trastuzumab given her HER2-positive disease.

On examination today, her performance status is 1. There is mild right leg lymphoedema but no concerning features. Chest is clear and abdomen soft with well-healing midline scar.

	Further investigations
	Baseline cardiac ECHO arranged for 25/4/24
Baseline audiology arranged for 26/4/24

	Medication prescribed
	Prophylactic dalteparin 5000 units daily for 28 days post-surgery

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up will be 29/4/24 to commence chemotherapy
Surgical follow up with [redacted name] arranged for 3 months

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function and FBC prior to chemotherapy
Please refer to lymphoedema service if symptoms worsen

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Detailed discussion regarding adjuvant chemotherapy with carboplatin AUC5 and paclitaxel 175mg/m2 every 21 days for 6 cycles with concurrent trastuzumab. Written information provided regarding side effects and emergency contacts. Advised about need for cardiac monitoring with trastuzumab.

primary_cancer.metastases: cervical stromal invasion, one positive pelvic lymph node
primary_cancer.histopathology_status: grade 3 serous carcinoma with lymphovascular space invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, omentectomy and pelvic lymphadenectomy
Histopathology confirms grade 3 serous carcinoma with cervical stromal invasion, lymphovascular space invasion, 1/12 positive lymph nodes
Molecular testing identifies TP53 mutation and HER2 positivity (IHC 3+)
CT staging shows no evidence of distant metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: mild lymphoedema of right leg responding to compression stockings
mild right leg lymphoedema, chest clear, abdomen soft with well-healing midline scar

status_updates.value: Recently diagnosed high-grade serous endometrial cancer post-surgery. Good post-operative recovery, preparing for adjuvant chemotherapy with trastuzumab
Planned for adjuvant carboplatin/paclitaxel with trastuzumab, awaiting baseline cardiac assessment
Oncology follow up 29/4/24 to commence chemotherapy, surgical follow up in 3 months
